com.bigdata.journal

Class TestHierarchicalLockingTasks

  • java.lang.Object
    • junit.framework.Assert
      • junit.framework.TestCase
        • junit.framework.TestCase2
          • com.bigdata.io.TestCase3
            • com.bigdata.journal.AbstractIndexManagerTestCase<S>
              • com.bigdata.journal.ProxyTestCase<Journal>
                • com.bigdata.journal.TestHierarchicalLockingTasks
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IProxyTest, junit.framework.Test

    public class TestHierarchicalLockingTasks
extends ProxyTestCase<Journal>
    Test suite for hierarchical locking of indices based on namespace prefixes. This test suite was introduced as part of the support for group commit for the RDF database layer in the non-scale-out modes. In order to be able to run RDF operations using job-based concurrency, we need to predeclare the namespace (rather than the individual indices) and then isolate all indices spanned by that namespace.
    Author:
    Bryan Thompson
    See Also:
    Concurrent unisolated operations against multiple KBs FIXME GROUP COMMIT (hierarchical locking): We need to test each different kind of index access here (unisolated, isolated by a read/write tx, and isolated by a read-only tx, and read-historical (no isolation)).

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void test_hierarchicalLocking_001()
      Test creates several named indices some of which have a shared namespace prefix and verifies that a lock declared for the namespace prefix permits that task to access any index in that namespace.
      void test_hierarchicalLocking_create_destroy()
      Unit test for hierarchical locking verifies that we can declared a namespace for a task which then creates multiple indices spanned by that namespace.

    • Method Detail

      • test_hierarchicalLocking_001

        public void test_hierarchicalLocking_001()
                                  throws InterruptedException,
                                         ExecutionException
        Test creates several named indices some of which have a shared namespace prefix and verifies that a lock declared for the namespace prefix permits that task to access any index in that namespace. The test also verifies that an index that does not share the namespace prefix may not be accessed by the task.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        ExecutionException

        Unit test for hierarchical locking verifies that we can declared a namespace for a task which then creates multiple indices spanned by that namespace.
        Throws:
        InterruptedException
        ExecutionException
